symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.apply._internal.flexState.FlexState
symbols.description:
Flex state class to persist maps and raw state (cache) for a given component reference. The persistence happens inside an object mapped to the component reference, with the following properties:

{ appDescriptorMap: {}, changesMap: {}, variantsMap: {}, storageResponse: { changes: { changes: [...], variants: [...], variantChanges: [...], variantDependentControlChanges: [...], variantManagementChanges: [...], ui2personalization: {...}, }, loadModules: }}, partialFlexState: , componentId: "" }

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: Component or control (instance or ID) on which the variantModel is set

parameters.name: variantReference
parameters.description: Reference to the variant that needs to be activated

methods.description: Activates the passed variant applicable to the passed control/component.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.apply.api.ControlVariantApplyAPI.clearVariantParameterInURL

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Variant management control for which the URL technical parameter has to be cleared

methods.description: Clears URL technical parameter sap-ui-fl-control-variant-id for control variants. Use this method in case you normally want the variant parameter in the URL, but have a few special navigation patterns where you want to clear it. If you don't want that parameter in general, set the updateVariantInURL parameter on your variant management control to false. SAP Fiori elements use this method. If a variant management control is given as a parameter, only parameters specific to that control are cleared.

methods.description: Retrieves the default variant for the current control synchronously. WARNING: The consumer has to make sure that the changes have already been retrieved with getChanges. It's recommended to use the async API getDefaultVariantId, which works regardless of any preconditions.

methods.description: Synchronously retrieves the ExecuteOnSelect for the standard variant for the current control. WARNING: The consumer has to make sure that the changes have already been retrieved with getChanges. It's recommended to use the async API getExecuteOnSelect, which works regardless of any preconditions.

returnValue.description: true if the variant downport scenario is enabled

methods.description: Indicates whether the variant downport scenario is enabled or not. This scenario is only enabled if the current layer is the VENDOR layer and the URL parameter hotfix is set to true.

properties.name: applyState
properties.description: Describes the current state of the change regarding the application and reversion of changes. To change or retrieve the state, use the getters and setters defined in this class. Initially the state is Change.applyState.INITIAL.

constructor.description:
Flexibility change class. Stores change content and related information.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.fl.Change with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.base.ManagedObject.extend.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description:
Can be used to manage variants. You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for key user adaptation.
Note: On the user interface, variants are generally referred to as "views".

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in edit state. If set to false, the footer of the Views list will be hidden.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true, an error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

properties.name: manualVariantKey
properties.description:
If set to true, the key for a vendor variant will be added manually.
Note:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description:
Determines the name of the model. The binding context will be defined by the current ID.

Note: In a UI adaptation scenario, this property is not used at all, because the model name is $FlexVariants.

properties.name: resetOnContextChange
properties.description: When set to false, doesn't reset the VariantManagement control to the default variant, when its binding context is changed.

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description: Indicates that Apply Automatically is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates that Set as Default is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs.

properties.name: updateVariantInURL
properties.description:
Determines the intention of setting the current variant based on passed information.

Note: The VariantManagement control does not react in any way to this property.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the controls for which the variant management is responsible.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new VariantManagement.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Determines the name of the model. The binding context will be defined by the current ID.

Note: In a UI adaptation scenario, this property is not used at all, because the model name is $FlexVariants.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setResetOnContextChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property resetOnContextChange.

When set to false, doesn't reset the VariantManagement control to the default variant, when its binding context is changed.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowExecuteOnSelection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showExecuteOnSelection.

Indicates that Apply Automatically is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowSetAsDefault

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showSetAsDefault.

Indicates that Set as Default is visible in the Save View and the Manage Views dialogs.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setUpdateVariantInURL

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property updateVariantInURL.

Determines the intention of setting the current variant based on passed information.

Note: The VariantManagement control does not react in any way to this property.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.
